sentences: Puutarhuri istutti uuden kasvin kukkapenkkiin. (The gardener planted a new plant in the flower bed.)
Olen kiinnostunut oppimaan lisää erilaisista kasveista ja niiden hoidosta. (I am interested in learning more about different plants and their care.)
Kasvit tarvitsevat vettä, valoa ja ravinteita kasvaakseen. (Plants need water, light and nutrients to grow.)
context: The word 'kasvi' in Finnish means 'plant'. It refers to a non-animal organism capable of photosynthesis. The word is derived from the verb 'kasvaa', which means 'to grow'.  It can be singular ('kasvi') or plural ('kasvit'). The dictionary definitions show many different forms and possessive cases, indicating how it changes depending on who owns the plant (e.g., 'kasvini' - my plant, 'kasvimme' - our plant).
